outcome:
ORDER/JUDGMENT IN CC 622/2019 OF JUDICIAL MAGISTRATE
OF FIRST CLASS-—I ,MANJERI
CRIME NO.385/2019 OF Manjeri Police Station , Malappuram
PETITIONER:
MUJEEB RAHMAN,
AGED 47 YEARS,
S/O.ABDURAHMAN ,
ALIYATHODI HOUSE, 22ND MILE,
MULLAMBARA ROAD, P.O.MANJERI,
MALAPPURAM DISTRICT.

REPRESENTED BY THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR,
HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM.
2 JAMSHEER ,
AGED 37 YEARS,
S/O.ABDULLA,
AARUVEETTIL HOUSE,
N.S.S.COLLEGE P.O., MANJERI,
MALAPPURAM DISTRICT-676 552.
R2 BY ADV. PRINSUN PHILIP
OTHER PRESENT:
SRI. C.S. HRITHWIK, SR. PUBLIC PROSECUTOR
THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON
07.01.2020, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING:

Crl.MC.No.8941 OF 2019(Gc) 2020/KERIS66
2
ORDER
Dated this the 7th day of January, 2020

The petitioner is the sole accused in C.C. No. 622 of 2019 on
the files of the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-I, Manjeri, for
having allegedly committed offences punishable under Sections 323 &
324 of the IPC. The 27? respondent who is the defacto complainant and
injured. He appeared through counsel and filed an affidavit to the effect
that the matter has been amicably settled with the petitioner and that he
has no further grievance against the petitioner. A report has been
obtained from the investigating Officer through the Senior Public
prosecutor. The petitioner has no criminal antecedents. No public
interest is involved.

Hence, the Crl.M.C is allowed and the entire proceedings in
C.C No.622/2019 on the files of the Judicial First Class Magistrate
Court-I, Manjeri stands quashed

THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON
07.01.2020, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING:

Crl.MC.No.8941 OF 2019(Gc) 2020/KERIS66
2
ORDER
Dated this the 7th day of January, 2020

The petitioner is the sole accused in C.C. No. 622 of 2019 on
the files of the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-I, Manjeri, for
having allegedly committed offences punishable under Sections 323 &
324 of the IPC. The 27? respondent who is the defacto complainant and
injured. He appeared through counsel and filed an affidavit to the effect
that the matter has been amicably settled with the petitioner and that he
has no further grievance against the petitioner. A report has been
obtained from the investigating Officer through the Senior Public
prosecutor. The petitioner has no criminal antecedents. No public
interest is involved.

Hence, the Crl.M.C is allowed and the entire proceedings in
C.C No.622/2019 on the files of the Judicial First Class Magistrate
Court-I, Manjeri stands quashed under Section 482 Cr.P.C and the
accused is discharged.

Sd/-
ASHOK MENON
JUDGE
